summary: The 'Penicillin Allergy Verification and Evaluation Act' (PAVE Act) aims to amend Title XVIII of the Social Security Act to include penicillin allergy verification and evaluation as part of the initial preventive physical examination and annual wellness visits under the Medicare program. The bill mandates identifying individuals with reported penicillin allergies, evaluating reaction histories, providing information on the impact of allergy labels, and, when appropriate, referring patients to allergy specialists. The effective date for these changes would be January 1, 2027.
